page.title: 20A TRANSECT ALONG PLYMYARD AV
page.content:
If one were to travel from the northern end of Plymyard Avenue to the southern end a journey of just under two miles it is possible to detect in the nature of the houses the changes that have gone on in the whole area in the last 70 years.
At the north end there are still to be found some large Victorian villas although some of these have either lost their very extensive gardens to more modern housing developments or been pulled down entirely to make way for a smal estate of exclusive houses. In the 1930's much of the southern end of the avenue was a very wet marsh and supported only one pig farm.Today all that has changed and a modern private estate of detached ,semi-detached and dorma bungalows fills in all the remaining space.
